data.title: Pink Hope at Heritage Credit Union
data.meta_description: Wisconsin credit union launches Pink Hope checking account that raises money for breast cancer research.
data.text:
Wisconsin credit union launches Pink Hope checking account that raises money for breast cancer research.

By Marc Rapport | May 15, 2012 at 08:21 AM

The $221 million Heritage Credit Union in Madison, Wis., has created a new Pink Hope checking account that includes a $5 donation to fight breast cancer with each account opened and a rounding up feature to generate even more funds.

The 22,500-member HCU said it will donate $5 to the American Cancer Society for breast cancer research with each opening, and that each transaction on debit cards from the account will be rounded up to the nearest dollar and the difference transferred into a Pink Hope donation account.

The free checking account has no minimum balance or service charges and HCU has launched a website for the effort.
